The healthcare sector faces a burned-out workforce, escalating administrative waste, and widespread dissatisfaction with digital tools that were meant to help.

articles.title: Tech won't kill education — it will return it to its roots
articles.author: Jon Stokes
articles.summary: In his day job at Symbolic AI, he's always trying to get state-of-the-art language models to produce text artifacts reflective of human steering, human insight, and human intelligence. Right now, we ask education to be way too many things: It's a rite of passage, a day care, a credential factory, a gatekeeper, and so on. Education should mainly be for those who truly want to learn. If someone is just trying to check a box, gain status, or please his parents or peers with the appearance of being educated, he'll use AI shortcuts.

articles.title: Tech Won't Kill Education, It'll Return It to Its Roots
